title: HSBC cuts interest rate on new Regular Saver accounts from 5% to 2.75%
text:
HSBC's Regular Saver rate has now been cut from 5 per cent to 2.75% for new customers

HSBC has almost halved the interest it pays savers putting aside money each month.

Its Regular Saver rate has now been cut from 5 per cent to 2.75 per cent for new customers.

Those already saving into a plan will continue to earn 5 per cent until their account comes to the end of its one-year term.

The rate at its offshoot, First Direct, has also been cut for new savers.

New savers depositing the maximum £300 each month will now earn £53 in interest a year, down from a previous £97.

Elsewhere, top regular savings plans come from Virgin Money and Saffron BS.

They pay a fixed 3 per cent for a year and let you take money out without charge during the term. You can save between £1 and £250 a month.
